phrases.text: Trèo lên quán dốc ngồi gốc ối a cây đa
phrases.english: Climb up the hilltop shrine, sit at the root, oh ah, banyan tree

culturalContext.description: Opening scene at sacred banyan tree on hilltop
facts: Banyan trees (cây đa) considered sacred in Vietnamese culture
Often located near village shrines (quán)
Popular gathering spots for festivals and meetings

phrases.text: rằng tôi lý ối a cây đa
phrases.english: they say I, Lý, oh ah, banyan tree

culturalContext.description: Refrain invoking song genre and tree symbol
facts: 'Lý' is the folk song genre being performed
'Rằng' adds narrative distance
Self-referential naming common in Vietnamese folk songs

phrases.text: rằng tôi lới ối a cây đa
phrases.english: they say I, loi, oh ah, banyan tree

facts: 'Lới' is melodic variant or regional pronunciation
Nearly identical to previous phrase
Creates musical variation while maintaining structure

phrases.text: Ai xui ối a tính tang tình
phrases.english: Who moved, oh ah, the heart's feeling

facts: 'Xui' means to stir emotionally (not bad luck here)
'Tính tang tình' mimics heartbeat or emotional sound
Introduces romantic theme
culturalContext.musicalContext: Emotional turning point with questioning tone

phrases.text: rằng cho đôi mình gặp xem hội
phrases.english: so that the two of us meet to watch the festival

culturalContext.description: Purpose of the meeting - village festival
facts: Village festivals (hội làng) important social occasions
Traditional courtship opportunity
'Đôi mình' implies romantic pair
Rằm (15th day) is full moon night
Festivals often held on full moon
Romantic associations with moonlight

phrases.text: rằng tôi lý ôi a cây đa
phrases.english: they say I, Lý, oh ah, banyan tree

facts: 'Ôi' instead of 'ối' - vowel variation
Returns to opening refrain
Creates cyclical structure

phrases.text: rằng tôi lới ối a cây đa
phrases.english: they say I, loi, oh ah, banyan tree

facts: Exact repetition of phrase 3
Provides symmetrical ending
Banyan tree as enduring symbol throughout
